entityId.localType: ISMAPNG Archives Bathurst Repository Series Number

biogHist.abstract: This series of records was created by St Joseph's Orphanage, Bathurst (Girls' Home). The series is made up of two volumes covering 1924-1974 (the Orphanage closed in 1975), and contains handwritten entries of details of children admitted to the Orphanage during that period.
biogHist.p: Application for access must be made, in writing, to the Archivist, providing personal identification documents to establish the right to access information. Physical access to the records is not permitted due to their fragility and the need to protect the confidentiality of information concerning other persons. Information will be forwarded by mail.

The Roll Books are managed by the Institute of the Sisters of Mercy of Australia and Papua New Guinea (ISMAPNG). ISMAPNG formed out of the consolidation of 14 of the 17 congregations of the Institute of the Sisters of Mercy in Australia, and from the region of Papua New Guinea. This included the Bathurst Congregation, which ran the St Joseph's Orphanage from 1867 until it closed down in 1975.

The records in this Series contain information including: year of Roll, name, date of admission, date of leaving and with whom. From the 1930s onward they may also include the following additional information: date of birth, where from, religion, Holy Communion, Confirmation (Volume 1 only). Volume 2 contains details of discharge plus some other notations on individuals relating to their family or status.

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Institute of Sisters of Mercy of Australia and Papua New Guinea Archives, Bathurst Repository (2011 - )

descriptiveNote.p: The ISMAPNG Archives, Bathurst Repository, holds the Roll Books, St Josephs' Orphanage, Bathurst.
